intro: Heliophila monosperma, commonly known as the single-seeded heliophyte, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Hydrocharitaceae, which includes aquatic and semi-aquatic plants. The plant typically grows in shallow water or moist soils, exhibiting submerged or floating leaves. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, often clustered in dense inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
